Z_as_a_function_of_X_and_Y.comment: Function must be aline of executable python code that has x and y as variables, and returns the desired z value. x,y,and z must be lower case.

min_x.comment: minimum value of x. REMINDER - NO QUOTES ON A NUMBER

max_x.comment: maximum value of x. REMINDER - NO QUOTES ON A NUMBER

num_x_steps.comment: number of steps to take between min_x and max_x. This is the number of facets in the X-direction. NO QUOTES ON A NUMBER

min_y.comment: minimum value of y.  REMINDER - NO QUOTES ON A NUMBER

max_y.comment: maximum value of y. REMINDER - NO QUOTES ON A NUMBER

num_y_steps.comment: number of steps to take between min_y and max_y. This is the number of facets in the Y-direction. NO QUOTES ON A NUMBER

output_type.comment: Must be either 'binary' or 'text'. Binary will be a much smaller file size.

output_filename.comment: Name of file. program will append '.stl' to the name

output_directory.comment: Where to write the file. Must be absolute path and written appropriate to the OS.

program_controls.comment: These input variable are used for debugging and logging. turning debug_v and/or debug_vv to True will provide more verbose output.
program_controls.logfile_threshold_comment: Any value other than those in threshold options will result in no loging to a file
program_controls.threshold options: CRITICAL, ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG, NOTSET = 0
